properties.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 1 at 4:01AM MST until January 3 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...A ROUND OF SNOW AND HAZARDOUS WINTER TRAVEL CONDITIONS FOR THE
NORTHERN MOUNTAINS...

.Snow will develop in the northern mountains of Colorado
this morning and become widespread and heavier by early
afternoon. Another increase in snowfall rates will occur this
evening before tapering off overnight. Light snow will continue
through Thursday. Gusty winds of 40 to 55 mph will also produce
blowing and drifting snow and reduced visibilities, in exposed
areas, and over the higher mountain passes. The heaviest totals
can be expected in the mountains north of Rabbit Ears Pass, with
moderate snowfall totals, in the Front Range Mountains and Summit
County.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to
20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass.

* WHEN...Until midnight MST Thursday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST THURSDAY NIGHT
